content:
• Thursday, August 30, 2012
  • ESL

    More on Esterline (NYSE:ESL): Q2 misses slightly as net profit swings to a loss due to a...

    More on Esterline (NYSE:ESL): Q2 misses slightly as net profit swings to a loss due to a writedown of a subsidiary business, though total revenue increased. The company boosts current quarter estimates to between $1.60 and $1.70 a share. Street estimates are projected at $1.59 a share. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • ZUMZ

    More on Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q2 misses on its bottom line despite higher total revenues. Net...

    More on Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q2 misses on its bottom line despite higher total revenues. Net earnings slipped 19% on higher expenses, and August same-store sales growth came in below expectations. The company also gave a gloomy Q3 forecast, saying it expects to earn between $0.42 and $0.45 per share, on sales in a range of $181M to $185M. Street estimates are for the company to earn $0.56 a share on $182.8M in revenue. Shares -14% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • SPLK

    More on Splunk's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $45M-$47M and FY13 (ends Jan. '13)...

    More on Splunk's FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $45M-$47M and FY13 (ends Jan. '13) revenue of $183M-$186M, above Street estimates of $44.7M and $178.3M. FQ2 free cash flow totaled $2.2M, in spite of a small operating loss. Deferred revenue +14% Q/Q to $67.7M. License revenue +61% Y/Y and 67% of total sales. Maintenance revenue +99%. Opex +69%, thanks to aggressive sales and R&D spending. SPLK +12.3% AH. Other big data plays are also up: INFA +3.7%. TIBX +1.6%. QLIK +2%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ1 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $258.1M...

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ1 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $258.1M (+18.3% Y/Y) beats by $15M. Shares +11.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $44.5M (+71% Y/Y) beats by...

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $44.5M (+71% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI) announces plans to separate into two independent, publicly traded companies focused...

    SAIC (SAI) announces plans to separate into two independent, publicly traded companies focused on government technical services and enterprise information technology. The spin-off is expected to occur in the latter half of next fiscal year, pending board approval. Shares +11.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.85B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $200M. Shares...

    SAIC (SAI): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.85B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $200M. Shares +15.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • GMAN

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q2 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $128.2B (+9.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q2 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $128.2B (+9.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -8.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q2 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $135.1M (+20.4% Y/Y) in-line....

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q2 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $135.1M (+20.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ESL

    Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ3 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $485.9M misses...

    Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ3 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $485.9M misses by $2M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • FSLR

    The entire solar sector is taking a beating from First Solar's (FSLR -18.6%) woes and a string...

    The entire solar sector is taking a beating from First Solar's (FSLR -18.6%) woes and a string of weak earnings reports from China Sunergy (CSUN -7.5%), JA Solar (JASO -1%) and Yingli Green (YGE -10.8%). ThinkEquity cuts YGE to Sell based on “persistent losses," setting a price target of $1; Maxim warns of a "mounting” cash drain and net debt that “has reached dangerous heights."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 12 Comments
  • GEF

    Despite Greif's (GEF +8.8%) 39% earnings drop in FQ3, the packaging company reported sales that...

    Despite Greif's (GEF +8.8%) 39% earnings drop in FQ3, the packaging company reported sales that appear relatively in line with consensus expectations and that it's free cash flow was a bright spot in the quarter. KeyBanc says GEF's recently downwardly revised fiscal year guidance, which the company reaffirmed, appears conservative.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPN

    Wholesale power producer Calpine (CPN +2.5%) is upgraded to Overweight with a new $21 target...

    Wholesale power producer Calpine (CPN +2.5%) is upgraded to Overweight with a new $21 target price based on improving fundamentals in Texas, where recent work by the state's public utility commission highlighted a tightening power market. Also cited: CPN's gas-fired profile not dependent on commodity prices, strong free cash flow generation, and a friendly shareholder track record.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceutical (IRWD -7.2%) slides after resuming trading following an earlier halt on...

    Ironwood Pharmaceutical (IRWD -7.2%) slides after resuming trading following an earlier halt on the news of FDA approval of its IBS drug Linzess. Cantor looks to have been dead on earlier this month when it predicted that IRWD shares would likely sell off on the news, regardless of its outcome. Cantor said at the time that the stock was overvalued, and "investors may play the event and then exit the stock post-approval due to lack of pending positive catalysts."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • BRLI

    Shares of Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -9.5%) get hammered, despite its FQ3 beating on its...

    Shares of Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -9.5%) get hammered, despite its FQ3 beating on its bottom line earlier today. Net earnings rose 25% Y/Y, as the clinical-testing company's streak of double-digit revenue growth continued, but investors appear to be taking advantage of near 52-week highs to lock in profits as sales growth shows signs of stagnating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLCH

    Struggling investment bank Gleacher (GLCH +3.8%) says it hired a financial adviser to explore...

    Struggling investment bank Gleacher (GLCH +3.8%) says it hired a financial adviser to explore strategic alternatives, including partnering with equity investors, acquisitions, asset sales or a business combination. Eric Gleacher was among a bevy of 1980s-era bankers including Steve Schwarzman and Bruce Wasserstein who went on to start their own advisory boutiques.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • INCY

    Baird is out defending Incyte (INCY -1.9%) today after the company announced the departure of...

    Baird is out defending Incyte (INCY -1.9%) today after the company announced the departure of its Chief Commercial Officer yesterday. The firm notes that while being less than a year into its first product launch may not the ideal time for a change, it's comfortable that it isn't any performance-related issue, and the company can manage the transition with minimal disruption. INCY management says the move has nothing to do with the launch trajectory - which is most important to investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -1.5%) announces the publication of two papers in the journal Cell...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -1.5%) announces the publication of two papers in the journal Cell demonstrating that single-stranded short interfering RNA molecules distributed broadly, activated the RNA interference pathway and selectively inhibit the expression of a targeted gene in animal models. The stock is down today however, largely due to technicals after re-testing but failing to break through its 52-week high late yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -15%) goes into freefall following news it has halted deliveries for the $1.8B...

    First Solar (FSLR -15%) goes into freefall following news it has halted deliveries for the $1.8B Agua Caliente Arizona solar plant due to construction being ahead of schedule. Agua Caliente, a 51/49 JV between NRG Energy (NYSE:NRG) and Berkshire Hathaway's MidAmerican Energy, is already 85% built, even though the project isn't scheduled for completion until the end of 2013. The halt may be stoking fears First Solar's recent growth was padded by aggressive deliveries. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • NRP

    Natural Resource Partners (NRP -1.5%) is initiated with a Hold at Dahlman Rose, which sees coal...

    Natural Resource Partners (NRP -1.5%) is initiated with a Hold at Dahlman Rose, which sees coal royalty growth limited by reduced Appalachian production but the current distribution will be maintained. The firm expects Illinois Basin investment offsetting much of the Appalachian declines, but no significant catalysts to grow payouts in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -5.7%) is initiated with a Neutral rating and $6 price target at Goldman...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR -5.7%) is initiated with a Neutral rating and $6 price target at Goldman Sachs. While the firm is positive on shale exposure from Bakken, Eagle Ford and Marcellus, MHR is still building in these areas and scale is crucial to confidence in longer-term execution.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • ERIC

    Ericsson (ERIC -3.7%) slumps after getting hit with a downgrade to Underperform from Credit...

    Ericsson (ERIC -3.7%) slumps after getting hit with a downgrade to Underperform from Credit Suisse. Soft European markets and Ciena's guidance probably aren't helping either. CS downgraded Ericsson to Neutral in January.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • BPT

    BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (BPT +14.8%) is bouncing big after a disastrous three days since...

    BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (BPT +14.8%) is bouncing big after a disastrous three days since WSJ ran a cautious article on the group, which noted that royalty trusts trade at a premium to the present value of their cash available for distribution. Someone must be seeing blood in the Bay, now finding the risk/reward characteristics of this long-term cash machine more attractive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 13 Comments
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +6.2%) pops on the back of the FDA's approval for Ironwood...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +6.2%) pops on the back of the FDA's approval for Ironwood (NASDAQ:IRWD) and Forest Labs' (NYSE:FRX) Linzess. The company's own drug Plecanatide shares the same origins and mechanism of action as Linzess, and results from recently-closed Phase IIb/III trials on the drug should be out by the closing weeks of December.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • AMPL

    Ampal-American Israel (AMPL -31.5%) filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy yesterday in a move to...

    Ampal-American Israel (AMPL -31.5%) filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy yesterday in a move to restructure its debt. AMPL has been suffering cash-flow problems after Egypt's state-run gas company canceled its contract to supply natural gas to Israel through East Mediterranean Gas, which AMPL owns a 12.5% state in, earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • TLAB

    Also selling off (previous) thanks to the poor guidance accompanying Ciena's FQ3 report: TLAB...

    Also selling off (previous) thanks to the poor guidance accompanying Ciena's FQ3 report: TLAB -3%. ALU -2.2%. CALX -2.9%. JNPR -4.6%. NPTN -3.8%. OCLR -3.9%. With AT&T and Verizon trying to boost near-term profits by keeping capex down, European carriers struggling with macro and debt issues, and Chinese carriers also beginning to put the brakes on spending, there are plenty of reasons to be worried about telecom equipment demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • ANGI

    A day after jumping on an Oppenheimer upgrade, Angie's List (ANGI -6.6%) is returning most of...

    A day after jumping on an Oppenheimer upgrade, Angie's List (ANGI -6.6%) is returning most of its gains thanks to a downgrade to Hold from Canaccord. The firm now doesn't expect Angie's to turn a profit until 2015 (it previously forecast 2014 profits) due to high sales/marketing spending and slightly higher churn. It also thinks a huge short interest (~25% of float) and recent VC distributions (related to Angie's lockup expiration) will add to near-term volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P +18.8%) is breaking out of that trading range it has been stuck in, as shorts cover...

    Pandora (P +18.8%) is breaking out of that trading range it has been stuck in, as shorts cover following a solid earnings report fueled by soaring mobile ad sales. SunTrust and Canaccord are upgrading Pandora to Buy - the latter cites improving visibility, moderating content costs, and stronger mobile monetization. Canaccord now sees Pandora generating $40 in 2015 revenue per thousand mobile ads, up from a prior $25. Mobile display ad firm Millennial Media (MM +3.1%) is also higher. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • GSV

    Gold Standard Ventures (GSV +12.8%) confirms interests acquired in the Pinon gold deposit south...

    Gold Standard Ventures (GSV +12.8%) confirms interests acquired in the Pinon gold deposit south of its flagship railroad project in Nevada's Carlin Trend. Leases grant GSV the exclusive right to explore, mine and develop varying percentage holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • TFM

    The Fresh Market (TFM -2.2%) trades lower to extend a slump that hit yesterday following shortly...

    The Fresh Market (TFM -2.2%) trades lower to extend a slump that hit yesterday following shortly after a seemingly upbeat earnings report from the company sparked an initial ill-fated rally. Investors are catching warnings that they should tread carefully with TFM, as the name is gets lined up as a new momo favorite and trading disconnects from fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 3 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli (YGE -7.6%) dives after ThinkEquity downgrades to Sell and Nomura reiterates a Reduce a...

    Yingli (YGE -7.6%) dives after ThinkEquity downgrades to Sell and Nomura reiterates a Reduce a day after the company posted yet another downbeat earnings report. Nomura points out Yingli's inventories are up to a hefty 400-450MW, something it thinks is partly due to European customers asking for short delivery times. Nomura also isn't pleased Yingli's net debt-to-equity ratio has risen to 254.5%, and declares the company to be obsesses with market share to the detriment of profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.5%) slumps in early trading. Though it might not be the...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.5%) slumps in early trading. Though it might not be the primary factor driving the dour sentiment on the name today, SA author Ben Strubel fires off a few warnings regarding the recent comments by GMCR management on inventory. In a nutshell, he struggles to find an answer as to why the company is growing inventory at such a seemingly unsustainable pace.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • KSS

    Shares of Kohl's (KSS +2.8%) trade higher after the retailer reports a better-than-expected...

    Shares of Kohl's (KSS +2.8%) trade higher after the retailer reports a better-than-expected increase in same-store sales. CEO Kevin Mansell says better merchandise and new marketing strategies contributed to the boost.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) move down 6.2% after S&P cuts the name from the S&P 500 Index...

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) move down 6.2% after S&P cuts the name from the S&P 500 Index after 55 years of inclusion. The issue was float, not relevancy, and it's also a bit ironic with 495 out of the 500 stocks on the list sporting YTD returns below that of SHLD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 10 Comments
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) shares +7.8% to $2.59 after Stifel Nicolas initiates the biotech company...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) shares +7.8% to $2.59 after Stifel Nicolas initiates the biotech company with a "buy" rating and gives it a price target of $4. The rating adds to the positive buzz surrounding Geron - a Seeking Alpha article earlier this month said the firm's drugs "have the potential to change the way cancer is treated."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -2.4% after Susquehanna downgrades to Neutral and sets a PT of $52....

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -2.4% after Susquehanna downgrades to Neutral and sets a PT of $52. Deutsche downgraded the chip equipment maker on Tuesday on concerns about softening demand from foundries. KLA shares are still trading fairly close to their 52-week high.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • CIEN

    More on Ciena's FQ3: The company expects FQ4 revenue of $455M-$480M, below a $499.5M consensus....

    More on Ciena's FQ3: The company expects FQ4 revenue of $455M-$480M, below a $499.5M consensus. It also expects gross margin to slip to ~40% from FQ3's 44.1%, and opex to grow to the "low $180s million" from FQ3's $175.2M. Optical transport (63% of sales) grew Y/Y but fell Q/Q. Ciena blames macro issues and "slower-than-expected rollouts" (likely related to 40G/100G optical gear) for its woes. CIEN -11.6%. Also lower: JDSU -2.2%. FNSR -2.7%. (other telecom equipment warnings: I, II, III, IV)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: How many ways are there to say "waiting for Jackson Hole?" Because that's what...

    Market preview: How many ways are there to say "waiting for Jackson Hole?" Because that's what everybody's been harping on about for the past few days, although expectations are falling that Ben Bernanke will announce QE3, putting a bit of a dampner on global stocks. U.S. futures are lower heading into the open, with the S&P Benchmark -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • VR

    Premarket gainers: FSR +15%. P +14%. GSV +14%. SRPT +12%. GERN +10%. VC +8%. Losers: CIEN -11%....

    Premarket gainers: FSR +15%. P +14%. GSV +14%. SRPT +12%. GERN +10%. VC +8%.
    Losers: CIEN -11%. VRA -9%. RBA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • JWN

    Shares of Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) trade 1.6% higher after the company reports August sales numbers....

    Shares of Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) trade 1.6% higher after the company reports August sales numbers. A shift in the timing of the company's Anniversary Sale distorted sales gains by a measure, but the overall read-through is still that the retailer's web and marketing initiatives are clicking.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI): Q2 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $172.3M...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI): Q2 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $172.3M (+16.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • JWN

    Nordstorm (NYSE:JWN) same-store sales: +21%. Total sales +25.2% to $866M. Shares +1.7%...

    Nordstorm (NYSE:JWN) same-store sales: +21%. Total sales +25.2% to $866M. Shares +1.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM

  • EU stocks mostly follow their Asian counterparts lower in early trading as investors get the...

    EU stocks mostly follow their Asian counterparts lower in early trading as investors get the jitters over Ben Bernanke's speech in Jackson Hole tomorrow. EU Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.2%, Frankfurt -0.6%, Madrid -0.4%, Milan +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 AM

  • Asian shares are lower following weak Japanese retail figures, falling commodity prices and...

    Asian shares are lower following weak Japanese retail figures, falling commodity prices and disappointing earnings, and, of course, ahead of Jackson Hole tomorrow. Japan -0.9%. Hong Kong -1.1%. China -0.2%. India -0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 AM
